required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Yoga Efficacy and Bioactive Materials in the Blood of Korean Elderly
clinical_study.official_title: The Studies of Yoga Efficacy and Bioactive Materials in the Blood of Korean Elderly

brief_summary.textblock: This study is conducted to verify the relationships between yoga efficacy and bioactive materials in the blood of Korean elderly.

detailed_description.textblock: Glycoproteomics approach will be applied to verify the relationships between yoga efficacy and bioactive materials in the blood of Korean elderly.

primary_outcome.measure: Measuring the number of glycoproteins in blood between before and after participation in an elderly yoga program for both the Advanced group and Beginner group
primary_outcome.description: Glycoproteins in human plasma are known to be deeply associated with multiple diseases, cell differentiation, aging, and etc. The efficacy of elderly yoga will be assessed by identifying and comparing the number of glycoproteins in blood between before and after participation in an elderly yoga program for both the Advanced group and Beginner group.

arm_group.description: Yoga participant groups will practice elderly yoga for four months. We will collect their blood before and after their participation in the elderly yoga program. There will be two subgroups which are Advanced group and Beginner group.

Non-Yoga participant groups will not practice yoga for four months and will be used as the control. We will collect their blood before and after the elderly yoga program. There will be two subgroups which are Elderly group and Young group.

intervention.intervention_name: Participation in the elderly yoga program
intervention.description: Yoga participant groups will practice elderly yoga for four months.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- The elderly group participant over 60 years old.
- The young group participant over 20 to 57 years old.
- Individual who can read and understand Korean.
- Participant is willing and able to give informed consent for participation in the study.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Participant who was diagnosed with cancer in the last five years.
- In case of participants leaving the yoga program after the primary blood collecting, they will be excluded from the secondary blood collecting.
- Individuals who are judged inappropriate for the study.
